ultimate_scaler.commands.locate.pos.not_: Position not found in given distance
ultimate_scaler.commands.locate.pos.rang: Range is too big, try a smaller value
ultimate_scaler.config.version_comment: The version of the configuration file, do not modify this value manually.
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer1: A1. Okay... many people may think that this Mod is meaningless. In fact, this Mod was created to explore the far lands and distance effects. If you are not familiar with the far lands of modern versions, try entering a world first, then fill in the first empty of the “Global coordinate offset” with “6.1e28”, and then run far away, and you will be amazed by the scenery in front of you.
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer2: A2. Offset first, and then scale with the coordinate origin as the center, that is, terrain coordinates = block coordinates * scale + offset
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer3: A3. Coordinates = (2^63 * divisor + 2^31) / sampling increment (affected by precision loss). For X/Z far lands, the sampling increment is 171.103.
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer4.1:
Grammar: §7/locate pos §b<originalPos> §e<scale> §a<offset> §d[range]§r
Arguments：§b
<originalPos>§f: int/String, the original X/Y/Z coordinate;§e
<scale>§f: double, scale multiplier, must be greater than 0;§a
<offset>§f: double, offset;§d
[range]§f: int/String, the maximum distance to search for the position, default is 1.797×10^308 ÷ scale - offset。§r
Example: The far lands are generated at X/Z = 1808764368955220359643137 without any offset or scaling. To find the position of the terrain generation when the X-axis scale is 8 and the offset is equal to this value, use the command as follows:
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer4.3:
This command outputs -16777215, which means that the far lands after scaling and offset start generating at -16777215 on the X-axis.
This command may not be useful when the coordinates are small, but it is very useful when the coordinates are large and affected by precision loss.
Note: BigInteger can achieve precise offset, and this command is not needed to calculate it.
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer5: A5. The density function “y_clamped_gradient” limits the range of noise-based terrain generation to -64 < Y < 256, and when the “Extra Y-axis offset” is enabled, this density function will also be offset, so the Y-axis far lands will not generate. If you want to generate it, you must use data packs or other methods (usually, removing the original “minecraft:y_clamped_gradient” density function is enough).
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer6: A6. Yes, but please note that the users of the modpack must bear the risk of using this Mod. (There are people who want to add this Mod to their modpack? No way!)
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer7: A7. Usually, this happens because of errors in this Mod or other mods. However, beyond the limits of the vanilla Minecraft, there is no standard for how to modify, so it is not always which mod is wrong, but just different standards. (But, if there is a difference with the vanilla behavior, it is§l definitely§r the fault of this Mod.)
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer8: A8.Currently, there is no donation channel, because I will not dare to ask for money from others by my dirty code. Small donations will not speed up the Mod's updates or improve its quality, because I am a student and it's impossible for me to give up my studies to develop this mod. If you really have a donation in mind, thank you for your kindness.
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.answer9: A9.No, because this Mod has no public API.
ultimate_scaler.options.faq.question1: Q1. So what the hell is the purpose of this Mod?

ultimate_scaler.options.tweaks.fixChunkG: Fix crash when generating chunks out of reasonable bounds

From 1.21.2, when generating chunks out of reasonable bounds (x/z beyond ±33552992), the game will crash.
The exception thrown is: IllegalStateException("Trying to create chunk out of reasonable bounds: " + pos)
This is obviously a human restriction.
ultimate_scaler.options.tweaks.expandDat: Expand the range of literal values in datapacks

In datapacks, many density function options have value ranges that are limited, such as the range of constant terms.
Enabling this option will remove these restrictions.
ultimate_scaler.options.tweaks.expandWor: Removes the air walls at 30000000 and removes the limits of commands like /tp and /worldborder.
ultimate_scaler.options.tweaks.fixMinesh: Fix crash when generating mineshafts at extreme coordinates
Due to integer overflow, when generating mineshafts at extreme coordinates (X/Z beyond ±1073741824), the game will crash. Enabling this option will extend the range to ±2147483647.
ultimate_scaler.options.general.optionMe: The keybinding to open configuration menu
ultimate_scaler.options.general.showTerr: Display offset terrain coordinates in debug screen
Enter a decimal value,
including a literal value or a scientific notation value expressed with "E" or "e".
ultimate_scaler.options.require_restart: Changes may require a restart to take effect
ultimate_scaler.options.server.publicTer: Public terrain coordinates to other players
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.FarLand: Custom the position of the Far lands by modifying the divisor in the MaintainPrecision method (default: 33554432).
Removed the Far lands, but the terrain stops generating at an extreme far distance (~1.05e+306).
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.bigInte: Rewriting the terrain generation using BigInteger, allows for more precise terrain offsetting in a wider range.
may cause the terrain generation to be much slower and consume more memory.
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.experim: Warning: Experimental features, unstable and may cause crashes or other issues.
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.extraYO:
Offset more factors that affect the Y-axis, enabling it can get more reasonable Y-axis terrain.
Note that when this option is enabled, all the far lands of the Y-axis will not generate without modifying the terrain generation algorithm.
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.fixEndR:
In vanilla Minecraft, due to integer overflow, the terrain of the End will be missing in several circular regions centered at the world origin (MC-159283), which are called "End Rings".
Enabling this option will fix this issue.
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.header: WARNING: Modifications may not be 100% in line with theoretical expectations.
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.limitRe: Limit the return value of the maintainPrecision method
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.maintai: Note: Too large or too small values can cause problems with terrain generation, and the recommended range is 512~4294967295.
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.maxNois: Max return value of the method (10^n)
Setting to a specific value can remove the Fringe lands.
ultimate_scaler.options.worldgen.replace: Replace any dimension's default fluid (overworld: water; nether: lava; end: air) with the specified block.
Replace the underground lava (Y<-54) in the overworld with the specified block (not necessarily effective).
